result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary J Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will maintain absolute sobriety,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

DE will pay court costs, submit a DNA sample/pay surcharge

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended.

timeConds.notes: DE will have credit for 26 days served.

records.addlTxt: Notice of completion of PD services.
Notice of completion of PD services.

Defendant Mary J Roth in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas.  Defendant Mary J Roth in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No additions or corrections to revocation packet.  State asking for 6-9 month jail. DE has credit for 75 days credit.  Atty Thomas enters argument.  Ms Roth addresses the court.  Court will sentence to 9 month jail each count, concurrent, will have huber for work, treatment, credit for good time, 75 days credit, can serve in eau claire county,
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 3, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
No JOC sent to DE as we do not have an address on record.

records.addlTxt: Case settlement

Defendant Mary J Roth in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Defendant Mary J Roth in custody.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Atty Olson recites agreement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea to Ct's 1 and 2.  Ct 3 will be DRI.  Recommendations will be for withheld sentence, one year probation, 30 days jail.  DE has credit for 26 days served.  Ct 1, GNC, court finds DE guilty, will order sentence withheld, one year probation,  CC/DNA sample, absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, alcohol etc.  Ct 2, withhold sentence, 1 year probation, 30 days jail, with 26 days credit to apply, CC/DNA sample/surcharge, absolute sobriety.
Return on warrant on November 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
WISCONSIN APPLICATION ONLY. WILL NOT EXTRADITE
Attorney Aaron Olson in court.  Annette M Barna appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not appear.  $1000.00 cash bench warrant, WI application only.  No extradition.
